justification: "In a standard delay discounting task… The extent in which the delayed amount has to be larger than the immediate amount for the participant to choose it indicates the participant's delay discounting tendencies. … the area under each of the discount functions (AUC) … was computed to provide a valid and reliable estimate of the degree in which a participant discounts delayed rewards."

"The flanker task measures information processing and selective attention (Eriksen & Eriksen, 1974)… The flanker scores were a normed combination of accuracy and reaction time (RT)… Thus, higher flanker scores represent a better performance in the task."
